maqras.text: Have We not expanded your chest
And removed from you your burden
Which galled your back
And raised high the esteem you are held
So indeed, with every difficulty there is relief
Indeed, with every difficulty there is relief
Therefore, when you are free, still labor hard
And turn all of your attention to your Lord
By the fig and the olive
And Mount Sinai
And this city of security
We have indeed created the human being in the best of forms
Then We debase them to the lowest of the low
Except those who believe and do righteous deeds, for they will have a reward unfailing
Then what can, after this, deceive you about the judgment
Is not God the Wisest of Judges
Read, in the name of your Lord who created
Created the human being from a zygote
Proclaim, and your Lord is Most Bountiful
He Who taught the use of the pen
Taught the human being that which he knew not
No, but the human being transgresses all bounds
When he looks upon himself as self-sufficient
Indeed, to your Lord is the return
Do you see one who forbids
A worshipper when he turns to pray
Have you seen whether he has guidance
Or encourages righteousness
Do you see if he denies and turns away
Does he not know that God sees
Let him beware, that if he does not desist, We will drag him by the hair of his head
His lying, sinful head
Then let him call to his advisers
We will call on the angels of punishment
No, do not follow, but bow down in adoration, and bring yourself ever closer
We have indeed revealed it in the Night of Power
And what will explain to you what the Night of Power is
The Night of Power is as good as a thousand months
There comes down the angels and the spirit by God's permission, for every will
Peace, until the rise of morn
Those who reject it among the people of the Book and among the polytheists were not going to depart until there came to them clear evidence
A messenger from God, rehearsing scriptures kept pure
In it are laws, right and straight
Nor did the people of the Book form sects, until after there came to them clear evidence
And they have been asked no more than this— to worship God, offer Him sincere devotion, be truthful, establish prayer, and give zakat, and that is the way of life which is right and straight
Those who reject it among the people of the Book and among the polytheists, will be in hellfire, to dwell therein forever. They are the worst of creatures
Those who have faith and do righteous deeds, they are the best of creatures

Their reward with God is gardens of eternity, beneath which rivers flow, they will dwell therein forever, God well pleased with them, and they with Him. All this for those who are conscious of their Lord
When the earth is shaken to its utmost convulsion
And the earth throws up its burden
And the human being yells, “What is the matter with it?”
On that day it will declare its information
Because your Lord would have given it inspiration
On that day, humanity will proceed in groups sorted out, to be shown their deeds
Then anyone who has done an atom’s weight of good see it
And anyone who has done an atom’s weight of wrong will see it
By those who race with panting breath
And strike sparks of fire
And push home the charge in the morning
And raise the dust in clouds
And move forward en masse
Truly the human being is ungrateful to their Guardian Evolver
And to that they bear witness
And violent is their love of wealth
